abstract: For some reason, we have created this culture where the chief executive is supposed to be infallible, to have all of the answers and to be able to get the company out of any situation.

lead_paragraph: About five years ago, I began mentoring a creative and vibrant young woman named Meghan Chambers. Ms. Chambers, who was 23 at the time, had taken a chance by opening a retail shop in Springfield, Mo., called Staxx. She believed in the revitalization of the downtown area of the city and she was one of the first businesses to strike out there – something that earned her quite a bit of press and recognition.

headline.main: A Reluctant Retailer Decides to Open Her Books
